1.1. Acquiring and Updating Procedure

Contents

  1. Introduction
  2. First Time Installation
  3. Updating
  4. Release Procedure

Introduction

cmlib is maintained at a central git repository at http://www.github.com/chancemedia/cmlib.

First Time Installation

If you are installing a new copy of cmlib you can install it from two main methods:

1. Use:

$ git clone git://github.com/chancemedia/cmlib.git

2. Goto the download page at http://github.com/chancemedia/cmlib/downloads and download the latest stable tag.

Do not change any files in your cmlib/ directory or future updates will be overridden.

Updating

It is recommended you use git to update:

$ cd change/to/inside/cmlib/

$ git pull

Once all the latest changes have been downloaded you want to use to choose the latest stable tag so that you are not left with debug or bleeding edge code. 

$ git tags
v1.0a1
v1.0a2
v1.0
v1.2
v1.2.1
v1.3b

Select the latest stable release version "v1.2.1" and checkout the tag. This will move your cmlib version to this snapshot in time.

$ git checkout v1.2.1

And your ready to go.

Release Procedure

1. Run test/testall.php. 2. Update srcdoc/manual_about_test.php with full test output. 4. Run scripts/doxygen.php to make sure there are no Doxygen warnings or errors. 3. Clean commit on master branch. 5. Run scripts/doc.php to generate and upload documentation. 6. Create version tag on master and gh-pages branches. 7. git push --tags
